intro: Echinops pauciflorus, commonly known as the spiny globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its spherical shape and spiny bracts that surround the flowering heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Echinops pauciflorus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a distinctive member of the Malvaceae family.
